clinical_study.brief_title: Factor XIII in Major Burns Coagulation
clinical_study.official_title: Major Burns Coagulation and the Role of Factor XIII: A Descriptive Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital Universitari Vall d'Hebron Research Institute

clinical_study.source: Hospital Universitari Vall d'Hebron Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective observational study in which FXIII levels and coagulation tests and cicatrization are measured during the 30 days after the thermal trauma.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective observational pilot study in which the levels of FXIII and coagulation, anticoagulation, fibrinolysis, endothelial tissue damage and cicatrization are at the arrival of the patient to hospital, 24 hours before the first surgical intervention, 24h After the first surgical intervention, at 7 days after the first intervention and at 30 days after the thermal trauma, in this moment the healing will also be evaluated. All burn patients who meet the proposed inclusion criteria will be included and entered into the Burn Unit of the Vall d'Hebron University Hospital from the start of the study until reaching a minimum of 20 cases or a temporary term of 2 years.

secondary_outcome.description: Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time blood levels
The Vancouver survey will be conducted on the state of healing
The POSAS survey will be conducted on the state of healing
Tewamether consists of two pairs of sensors to measure the humidity and temperature gradients in two different spacings
A surgical team survey will be performed on intraoperative bleeding (during the first debridal surgery)
The need of reintervention because of bleeding within the next 24 hours after the first debridal surgery will be registered
The percentage of debrided surface and type of debridement (in the first debriding surgery)
Estimated bleeding according to the modified Gross formula (in the first debriding surgery)

intervention.description: The following plasma values will be measured: prothrombin time, activated partial thromboplastin time, thrombin time, functional fibrinogen, lactate, base excess, fibrin monomers, Factor XIII, Factor XII, Factor VIII, Fact von Willebrand, Plasmin, Plasminogen, Alpha-2-antiplasmin, antithrombin, protein C, Heparan sulfate, synecan 1. Surveys on the state of healing and moisture titration will be performed using Tewamether

study_pop.textblock: Burned patients over 18 years of age with a burned body surface of 20% or more admitted to the burn unit of the Vall d'Hebron University Hospital from the start of the study to the end of the study with surgical burns ( Second grade or third grade) and for whom informed consent has been obtained

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Burned patients with a burned body surface of 20% or more
- Over 18 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- ABSI (Abbreviated Burns Severity Index) greater than or equal to 12
- Associated polytrauma
- Coagulation deficit previously known
- Treatment with anticoagulants
- Electrocution burns
- Admission into the unit after hour 6 after thermal trauma
- The refusal of the patient, familiar or responsible to participate in the study
